item.title: All Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 & Warzone Players To Get Battle Pass Tier Skips And More
item.content:encoded:
Activision has announced that all players of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone will receive 20 Battle Pass Tier skips. The move comes as a thank you to players as updates for the game wind down ahead of the launch of Call of Duty: Black Ops 7.

In order to get your free Battle Pass Tier skips, players simply have to login to either Black Ops 6 or Warzone between now and September 16. Once you do, they will automatically be added to your account.

Activision says that the Black Ops 6 Season 5 Reloaded update will “be larger on some platforms” due to “reorganizing Call of Duty content to prepare for the Black Ops 7 Beta on October 2.” Because of the size of the update, Activision will be giving players a number of double XP tokens on all platforms.

Those who download the update and login to the game between September 4 and October 1 will get five 1-hour double player XP tokens, five 1-hour double weapon XP tokens, and five 1-hour double Battle Pass XP tokens. That equates to 15 hours of double XP in order to unlock and level up what you’re still grinding for.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Season 5 Reloaded launches on September 5. The update includes a new multiplayer map, more Zombies content, new and returning modes, and more. Full details for the update can be found on the Call of Duty website.

Are you going to go back into Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 with Season 5 Reloaded? Let us know down below, and take the discussion further in the Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the first details on the newly announced Call of Duty movie and read about Rocksteady hiring a former Assassin’s Creed game director for the same role. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
